intro: Sanguisorba officinalis f. latifoliata, commonly known as the broad-leaved sweetflag, is a cultivated form of the sweetflag plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for wetland gardens or pond edges. Its foliage is often used in floral arrangements due to its ornamental value. Additionally, it has historical uses in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
